translated: “Because of him you’re pale and thin,

original: yena bhattaṁ na ruccati;🔽Ayaṁ so āgato bhattā,
analyzed: yena bhattam na ruccati  ayam saḥ āgataḥ bhattā
translated: and food doesn’t appeal to you.
Here’s your husband, so why do you run away?”
“But if a relationship is formed🔽from the very beginning,

analyzed: santhavaḥ nāma jāyati  yasaḥ hāyati itthīna
tasmā tāta palāyaha  yasassinam kule jāta
translated: That’s why I run away, dear.”🔽“She who doesn’t want
one born in a famous family,
like the mare of the horse-dealer.”🔽The Horse-Dealer’s Daughter Jātaka is the sixth.
